data.title: Horace in the Renaissance
data.meta_description: The Latin poet Horace had a very important role in the early-modern culture. He was seen as a repository of philosophy (mainly ethics, morals, and poetics), a guide to virtuous behavior, as well as a literary authority in terms of style. His ethical and existential...
